attributes.action: Stop Landlords From Charging Excessive Amounts Over The Local Housing Allowance
attributes.additional_details:
With no end to the current social housing crisis in sight hundreds of thousands of families have no other option other to turn to landlords in order to seek a place to live. However there is no regulation in order to keep these properties affordable for the majority of the country. 

The Government needs to introduce a law in which prevents landlords from charging more than 15% over the LHA by creating a complete ban or significantly increasing taxes for the landlords that do charge over this.
attributes.background: Regulate the prices that landlords charge for non-luxurious properties by introducing a law in which means landlords may not charge over 15% of the Local Housing Allowance for a standard property.

departments.name: Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/589028
